data.title: Transcriptome Profiling of Single Mouse Oocytes.
data.abstract:
1. Methods Mol Biol. 2018;1818:51-65. doi: 10.1007/978-1-4939-8603-3_7.

Transcriptome Profiling of Single Mouse Oocytes.

Borensztein M(1), Syx L(2), Servant N(3), Heard E(2).

Author information:
(1)Institut Curie, PSL Research University, CNRS UMR3215, INSERM U934, UPMC 
Paris-Sorbonne, Paris, 75005, France. maud.borensztein@curie.fr.
(2)Institut Curie, PSL Research University, CNRS UMR3215, INSERM U934, UPMC 
Paris-Sorbonne, Paris, 75005, France.
(3)Institut Curie, PSL Research University, Mines Paris Tech, INSERM U900, 
Paris, 75005, France. nicolas.servant@curie.fr.

Single-cell RNA-sequencing (scRNAseq) enables the detection and quantification 
of mature RNAs in an individual cell. Assessing single cell transcriptomes can 
circumvent the limited amount of starting material obtained in oocytes or 
embryos, in particular when working with mutant mice. Here we outline our 
scRNAseq protocol to study mouse oocyte transcriptomes, derived from Tang et 
al., Nat Methods 6(5):377-382, 2009 . The method describes the different steps 
from single cell isolation and cDNA amplification to high-throughput sequencing. 
The bioinformatics pipeline used to analyze and compare genome-wide gene 
expression between individual oocytes is then described.
